description: French braconni√®re, from Middle French braconniere, bragonniere, from Old Italian braconi, from braca.

entries.meaning: A skirt or apron of mail or lamellar armor, worn with plate armor, to defend the stomach, groin, and upper thighs.
examples: Danish warrior of the fourteenth century, whose armour is curious because of the braconniere or apron and loinguards in trellised work which partly cover the mailed hauberk.
